author: Michael Larabel
description: As some additional enticing Linux kernel patches posted this week for review, an updated patch series is working to optimize code generation during context switching...
title: New Patches Work To Optimize Code Generation For Linux Context Switching

author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to the proposed Hierarchical Queued NUMA-aware spinlocks for better performance, another interesting performance-enhancing patch series posted in the past 24 hours for the Linux kernel is for improving the performance of single-threaded tasks running on high core count CPU desktops / workstations / servers...
title: New Linux Patches Enhance Single-Threaded Performance On Many-Core CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: We eagerly await to see if the AMD ISP4 driver will be ready for mainlining in the imminent Linux v6.19 merge window but it's getting down to the wire and thus looking less likely it will make it unless action is taken in the coming days. Today though a sixth version of this AMD ISP4 image signal processor driver was posted for this last piece of the puzzle in enabling the web camera on the HP ZBook Ultra G1a Strix Halo laptop as well as future Ryzen high-end laptops...
title: AMD ISP4 Linux Webcam Driver Updated For HP ZBook Ultra G1a & Future Ryzen Laptops

author: Michael Larabel
description: The NTFSPLUS Linux kernel driver as a modern NTFS file-system driver implementation continues quickly taking shape as it aims to become the most performant and feature-rich NTFS read/write driver for Linux systems...
title: NTFSPLUS Now Supports $MFT File Extension, FITRIM, More Mount Options

author: Michael Larabel
description: A Huawei engineer has sent out patches proposing HQspinlock as a Hierarchical Queued NUMA-aware spinlock for the Linux kernel. HQspinlock aims to addresss inefficiencies within the Linux kernel's spinlock on modern NUMA-systems due to frequent and costly cross-NUMA cache-line transfers...
title: HQspinlock Proposal For Linux Shows Very Nice Performance Benefits For Large Servers

author: Michael Larabel
description: As the one and last friendly reminder, if you enjoy the daily and original content found on Phoronix.com but not liking ads and wanting to view multi-page articles on a single page, native dark mode, and more: the 2025 Black Friday / Cyber Week deal is ending Monday to help support the site while enjoying a discounted rate...
title: Black Friday Reminder For Those Hating Ads But Loving Linux Hardware/Software

author: Michael Larabel
description: Vulkan 1.4.335 released a few hours ago as the latest iteration of this high performance graphics and compute API. With being just a week since the prior update and given the US Thanksgiving week, it's on the lighter side in terms of issues addressed. There is one new extension though and it's a big one: VK_EXT_present_timing is finally merged...
title: Vulkan 1.4.335 Released With The Very Notable VK_EXT_present_timing
